presentation.fsa
Class BezierEdge

java.lang.Object
  presentation.fsa.GraphElement
      presentation.fsa.Edge
          presentation.fsa.BezierEdge
All Implemented Interfaces:
PresentationElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
ReflexiveEdge
public class BezierEdge
extends Edge

The graphical representation of a transition in a finite state automaton. This edge is represented by a cubic bezier curve which can be reshaped by its control points.

Author:
Helen Bretzke, Sarah-Jane Whittaker, Lenko Grigorov

intersectionWithBoundary

public java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float intersectionWithBoundary(Node node,
                                                            int type)
Description copied from class: Edge
Computes an approximation to the point where this edge intersects the boundary of node. Returns the first point between midpoint of the edge and centre of Node with given type where this edge intersects the boundary of node, null if no intersection exists. NOTE more than one intersection is possible (e.g. reflexive edges and curved edges with multiple crossings).

Specified by:
intersectionWithBoundary in class Edge
type - SOURCE or TARGET
Returns:
the first point between middle of edge and centre of Node with given type where this edge intersects the boundary of node, null if no intersection exists.
See Also:
Edge.intersectionWithBoundary(presentation.fsa.Node, int type)

intersectionWithBoundary

protected float intersectionWithBoundary(java.awt.Shape nodeShape,
                                         java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float intersection,
                                         int type)
A simple binary search starting within the boundary of the given node shape. Sets the coordinates of intersection to the point where this curve intersects the boundary of nodeShape. If endpoints are both inside node (self-loop or overlapping target and source), then returns 0.5. Precondition: node is not null and intersection is not null

Parameters:
nodeShape - the shape representing this node
type - ignored
intersection - acts as a second return value; to be set to the point of intersection with the boundary of the given node shape
Returns:
the parameter t in [0,1] at which the bezier curve intersects node

insertAmong

public void insertAmong(java.util.Set<Edge> neighbours)
Sets this edge's layout to fit among the set of existing edges between its source and target nodes. Other edges' layouts are adjusted as necessary.

Parameters:
neighbours - the set of edges between the source and target nodes
